Banner.Description: I have worked as a Software Developer at Morgan Stanley. Worked on Full Stack development, used Angular for frontend and Springboot for the backend. Gained a beginner level understanding on cloud(Azure). At undergrad level, gained some hands-on experience, working on projects in the field of Machine Learning.
AboutMe.Title: About me
AboutMe.Paragraphs: From my little experience, I have learnt that one can never reach the pinnacle of any tech(especially with tech constantly evolving), but can only get one step closer everyday with constant and continued efforts put into that particular field. I seek to train every day. I do not want to commit to one particular tech, at this stage(beginning) of my career. Although, AI and Full stack development remain my area of expertise, I want to try out and explore different techs.

My Software Developer days at Morgan Stanley taught me a lot of things, things outside of Full Stack Development. It really helped me understand, what mindset is required of me, to adapt and contribute to a Global Firm, while meeting the Industry Standards.

I have always been facsinated by Machine Learning, right from my undergrad. My projects during my undergrad are evident to my interest towards the field. Clearly, AI is the future of the technology and I want to pursue my future in the field of AI.
Some of the technologies that I have trained and worked on include (but are not limited to):
Experience.Title: Experience

Experience.Jobs.Title: Software Developer
Description: I worked at Morgan Stanley as a software developer. Basically I was a full stack developer, used Angular for front end and Springboot for backend.
1. designing : (used a framework called 'wired frame', to design the UI from end-to-end).
Once I get approval on the design next step is developing
2. Developing : (used Angular to create reactive Web pages, which were then integrated to the Springboot backend)

3. Testing : Once the development is done..next step is testing. I used Karma(default testing tool offered by angular) to perform unit tests and then e2e tests(end-to-end tests). I capture the test cases in a test document.
4. Deployment : Once the tests are passed, the web application is deployed to Morgan's cloud using Jenkins.

Experience.Jobs.Title: Internship
Description: Worked on project - Student Portal Application ( Java, Springboot, MySQL, Angular)
Trained on Java, Springboot and worked on basic backend projects using them.
Hands-on experience on Angular, developed full stack POC apps using Angular for frontend and Springboot for backend.
Worked in groups, to practice agile methodology in Project Management.

Experience.Jobs.Title: Internship
Description: Worked on project - Online Car Rental scheme using JDBC (HTML, CSS, Javascript, Java, Tomcat, Mysql)
Built a web application using Java(DBC), tomcat and Mysql for backend, HTML, CSS and Javascript for frontend.
Aim of the project is to eliminate the middlemen between the renters and the lenders, allowing a fair, transparent and direct car rental business to take place between them.
The application allows consists of various types of profiles like renter, lender, admin based on thier role.

Experience.Jobs.Title: Internship
Description: Worked on project - Face Recognition using OpenCV (Python, OpenCV), which consisted of 2 parts
First part, upon execution captures the pictures of the face of the person in front of the camera, along with their name(to be entered by the user) and stores it locally, to train the model.
Second part, upon execution, opens the camera and scans for faces, identifies (highlights) the faces and displays name of the face, if its match is found in the local database.
This application fits into any security related use cases with a fairly decent accuracy.

FeatureProjects.Title: Projects that I was a part of
FeatureProjects.Label: Featured Project

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Meet Summariser using NLP
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description:
• The project takes an audio file(of a meeting) or a text file(of a meeting's transcript) as an input and Summaries the content of the meeting.
• Used Similarity Matrix, cosine difference and Google's pagerank algorithm to rank the sentence in the order of thier significance.
• Used Flask web development framework to develop the UI and to integrate it with the model.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Placement Prediction and Data Visualization
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description:
• Requested collage for the past 10 year's placement related data, normalized, cleaned and pruned the data, finally combining them all to obtain single dataset.
• Tried fitting the data into various Classified Machine Learning models like SVM, K-NN, Naive Bayes classifier to build the more accurate model
• Built a flask web application, to provide interface for the user, and to display the data visualization plots.
Technologies: Various supervised ML Algorithms like SVM, K-NN, Naive Bayes classifier

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Image Enhancement using GANS
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description:
• The aim is to enhance the quality of a LR (low resolution) image to a High Resolution using GANS (Generative adversarial network)
• Did a comparative analysis of the CNN model with other techniques like Median Filtering, Wiener Fillter to obtain better results.
• Created a simple graphical user interface, for the users to interact with our model.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Face Recognition using OpenCV
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description:
• First part, upon execution captures the pictures of the face of the person in front of the camera, along with their name(to be entered by the user) and stores it locally, to train the model.
• Second part, upon execution, opens the camera and scans for faces, identifies (highlights) the faces and displays name of the face, if its match is found in the local database.
• This application fits into any security related use cases with a fairly decent accuracy.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Stock Prediction using Machine Learning
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description:
• Trained the machine learning model using Random Forest, adjusted weights and biases to maximize the model's performance.
• Dataset of the stocks was taken from Kaggle.
• Created a GUI to take inputs and to show the result, using Python.
Technologies: various supervised ML algorithms like Decision Tree, Random Forest

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Online Car Rental Portal using JDBC
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description:
• Built a web application using Java(DBC), tomcat and Mysql for backend, HTML, CSS and Javascript for frontend.
• Aim of the project is to eliminate the middlemen between the renters and the lenders, allowing a fair, transparent and direct car rental business to take place between them.
• The application allows consists of various types of profiles like renter, lender, admin based on thier role.

OtherProjects.Projects.Title: Quiz App
OtherProjects.Projects.Description: A single page quiz app that has a minimal design. Integrated the app with Firebase Auth for user authentication.

OtherProjects.Projects.Title: Audio-to-Text
OtherProjects.Projects.Description: A basic python Flask project, that coverts audio into textual format.

Contact.Title: Get in touch!
Contact.Content: I will be happy to receive your contact if you want to talk about new opportunities. Write to me, and I will reply as soon as I read your message. Thank you for you time and effort, for going through my portfolio :)
